title: Using the MicroBioMap package
text: human microbiome, particularly large intestine, gaining attention role health disease, including conditions like colorectal cancer inflammatory bowel disease. Various factors, including genetics ethnicity, influence human microbiome, often tied geographic regions. result, individuals different global regions tend distinct gut microbiomes. research shown significant variation gut microbiome across countries social groups, much microbiome literature focused limited range subjects, raising questions generalizability findings. address limitations, researchers turned publicly available microbiome data, revealing overrepresentation high-income countries like United States Finland major microbiome research repositories. However, significant variations Western baseline observed communities studied. suggests current understanding microbiome may limited due geographic gaps research. bridge gap enhance field’s bioinformatic capabilities, Human Microbiome Compendium introduced. comprises 168,000 human gut microbiome samples 68 countries, processed using advanced tools made accessible various formats, including MicroBioMap R package dedicated website. dataset used analyze global patterns microbiome composition identify areas knowledge human gut microbiome lacking.

title: Using the MicroBioMap package
text: Amplicon processing conducted according following criteria: quantity forward read files corresponded number reverse read files, proceeded paired-end sequencing analysis. However, cases mismatch absence reverse reads, project treated single-ended data. scenarios, employed DADA2 version 1.14.0 data processing (B. J. Callahan et al. 2016). utilized broad parameter settings intended maximize inclusion samples excluding low-quality data: Specifically, apply fixed trimming either end impose maximum read length. Reads shorter 20 nucleotides, containing ambiguous (“N”) base calls, reads aligning phiX genome (typically present control Illumina sequencing runs) eliminated. Additionally, quality-based truncation reads disabled. Paired-end reads merged minimum overlap 20 bases. certain instances, merging process failed, resulting minimal merging forward reverse reads, often associated sequencing strategies featuring non-overlapping reads. studies less 50 percent forward reads merged successfully, opted discard reverse reads rather concatenate . decision aimed prevent failures merging due low-quality calls discrepancies forward reverse read files. cases, reverse reads excluded, projects reprocessed single-ended data. number forward reads align number reverse reads within sample, attempt made employ DADA2 identify sequence identifier field FASTQ file, facilitating alignment salvageable samples. cases attempt proved unsuccessful, reverse reads removed, data reprocessed single-ended. Taxonomic assignment carried DADA2, utilizing SILVA database release 138.1 reference (Quast et al. 2013; McLaren Callahan 2021).

title: Using the MicroBioMap package
code: library(MicroBioMap) # this operation requires about 4GB of RAM cpd <- getCompendium() cpd ## class: TreeSummarizedExperiment  ## dim: 4018 168464  ## metadata(0): ## assays(1): counts ## rownames(4018): ##   Bacteria.Firmicutes.Clostridia.Oscillospirales.Ruminococcaceae.Subdoligranulum ##   Bacteria.Proteobacteria.Gammaproteobacteria.Burkholderiales.Alcaligenaceae.Achromobacter ##   ... ##   Bacteria.Proteobacteria.Alphaproteobacteria.Rhodobacterales.Rhodobacteraceae.Poseidonocella ##   Bacteria.CK-2C2-2.NA.NA.NA.NA ## rowData names(8): kingdom phylum ... species strain ## colnames(168464): PRJDB10485_DRR243823 PRJDB10485_DRR243824 ... ##   PRJNA764337_SRR15959628 PRJNA764337_SRR15959674 ## colData names(11): srs project ... iso region ## reducedDimNames(0): ## mainExpName: NULL ## altExpNames(0): ## rowLinks: NULL ## rowTree: NULL ## colLinks: NULL ## colTree: NULL

title: Using the MicroBioMap package
text: colData slot cpd object contains information samples. can examine names available metadata: can look samples available regions: Region Library strategy Instrument Country
code: names(colData(cpd)) ##  [1] "srs"              "project"          "srr"              "library_strategy" ##  [5] "library_source"   "pubdate"          "total_bases"      "instrument"       ##  [9] "geo_loc_name"     "iso"              "region" table(colData(cpd)$region) ##  ##            Australia/New Zealand        Central and Southern Asia  ##                             3916                             5602  ##   Eastern and South-Eastern Asia      Europe and Northern America  ##                            18461                           103564  ##  Latin America and the Caribbean Northern Africa and Western Asia  ##                             1215                             1557  ##                          Oceania               Sub-Saharan Africa  ##                                4                             5953  ##                          unknown  ##                            28192 table(colData(cpd)$library_strategy) ##  ## AMPLICON  ##   168464 table(colData(cpd)$instrument) ##  ##                454 GS   Illumina HiSeq 1500   Illumina HiSeq 2000  ##                  8790                   793                  2447  ##   Illumina HiSeq 2500   Illumina HiSeq 3000   Illumina HiSeq 4000  ##                 10975                   701                  2651  ##      Illumina MiniSeq        Illumina MiSeq Illumina NovaSeq 6000  ##                   438                134353                   920  ##           NextSeq 500           NextSeq 550           unspecified  ##                   820                   315                  5261 head(sort(table(colData(cpd)$geo_loc_name), decreasing = TRUE)) ##  ##        usa:new york                                     usa             missing  ##               14142               12880               12510                5532  ## denmark: copenhagen      not applicable  ##                5289                4317

title: Using the MicroBioMap package
text: row cpd represents one microbe. rowData contains data.frame- like set metadata columns kingdom, phylum, etc.
code: head(rowData(cpd)) ## DataFrame with 6 rows and 8 columns ##                                                                                                          kingdom ##                                                                                                      <character> ## Bacteria.Firmicutes.Clostridia.Oscillospirales.Ruminococcaceae.Subdoligranulum                          Bacteria ## Bacteria.Proteobacteria.Gammaproteobacteria.Burkholderiales.Alcaligenaceae.Achromobacter                Bacteria ## Bacteria.Proteobacteria.Gammaproteobacteria.Enterobacterales.Enterobacteriaceae.Escherichia-Shigella    Bacteria ## Bacteria.Firmicutes.Clostridia.Oscillospirales.Ruminococcaceae.Faecalibacterium                         Bacteria ## Bacteria.Proteobacteria.Gammaproteobacteria.Xanthomonadales.Xanthomonadaceae.Stenotrophomonas           Bacteria ## Bacteria.Actinobacteriota.Coriobacteriia.Coriobacteriales.Coriobacteriaceae.Collinsella                 Bacteria ## Bacteria.Firmicutes.Clostridia.Oscillospirales.Ruminococcaceae.Subdoligranulum                             Firmicutes ## Bacteria.Proteobacteria.Gammaproteobacteria.Burkholderiales.Alcaligenaceae.Achromobacter               Proteobacteria ## Bacteria.Proteobacteria.Gammaproteobacteria.Enterobacterales.Enterobacteriaceae.Escherichia-Shigella   Proteobacteria ## Bacteria.Firmicutes.Clostridia.Oscillospirales.Ruminococcaceae.Faecalibacterium                            Firmicutes ## Bacteria.Proteobacteria.Gammaproteobacteria.Xanthomonadales.Xanthomonadaceae.Stenotrophomonas          Proteobacteria ## Bacteria.Actinobacteriota.Coriobacteriia.Coriobacteriales.Coriobacteriaceae.Collinsella              Actinobacteriota ## title: Using the MicroBioMap package
text: select samples belong specific Bioprojects, can filter using “project” metadata column colData. example, create subset data belonging Bioprojects: PRJDB10485 PRJDB10527 PRJDB10528 PRJDB10612
code: head(unique(colData(cpd)$project)) ## [1] "PRJDB10485" "PRJDB10527" "PRJDB10528" "PRJDB10612" "PRJDB11845" ## [6] "PRJDB11894" project_ids <- c("PRJDB10485", "PRJDB10527", "PRJDB10528", "PRJDB10612") cpd_sub_by_project_ids <- cpd[, colData(cpd)$project %in% project_ids] cpd_sub_by_project_ids ## class: TreeSummarizedExperiment  ## dim: 4018 637  ## metadata(0): ## assays(1): counts ## rownames(4018): ##   Bacteria.Firmicutes.Clostridia.Oscillospirales.Ruminococcaceae.Subdoligranulum ##   Bacteria.Proteobacteria.Gammaproteobacteria.Burkholderiales.Alcaligenaceae.Achromobacter ##   ... ##   Bacteria.Proteobacteria.Alphaproteobacteria.Rhodobacterales.Rhodobacteraceae.Poseidonocella ##   Bacteria.CK-2C2-2.NA.NA.NA.NA ## rowData names(8): kingdom phylum ... species strain ## colnames(637): PRJDB10485_DRR243823 PRJDB10485_DRR243824 ... ##   PRJDB10612_DRR254611 PRJDB10612_DRR254699 ## colData names(11): srs project ... iso region ## reducedDimNames(0): ## mainExpName: NULL ## altExpNames(0): ## rowLinks: NULL ## rowTree: NULL ## colLinks: NULL ## colTree: NULL

what: Samples from a specific world region
title: Using the MicroBioMap package
text: select subset samples specific world region, subset “columns” dataset. following code ummarized regions available number samples region. Now, select samples , example, “Sub-Saharan Africa”.
code: sort(table(colData(cpd)$region), decreasing = TRUE) ##  ##      Europe and Northern America                          unknown  ##                           103564                            28192  ##   Eastern and South-Eastern Asia               Sub-Saharan Africa  ##                            18461                             5953  ##        Central and Southern Asia            Australia/New Zealand  ##                             5602                             3916  ## Northern Africa and Western Asia  Latin America and the Caribbean  ##                             1557                             1215  ##                          Oceania  ##                                4 cpd_africa <- cpd[, colData(cpd)$region == "Sub-Saharan Africa"] cpd_africa ## class: TreeSummarizedExperiment  ## dim: 4018 5953  ## metadata(0): ## assays(1): counts ## rownames(4018): ##   Bacteria.Firmicutes.Clostridia.Oscillospirales.Ruminococcaceae.Subdoligranulum ##   Bacteria.Proteobacteria.Gammaproteobacteria.Burkholderiales.Alcaligenaceae.Achromobacter ##   ... ##   Bacteria.Proteobacteria.Alphaproteobacteria.Rhodobacterales.Rhodobacteraceae.Poseidonocella ##   Bacteria.CK-2C2-2.NA.NA.NA.NA ## rowData names(8): kingdom phylum ... species strain ## colnames(5953): PRJDB10485_DRR243823 PRJDB10485_DRR243824 ... ##   PRJNA706727_SRR13886715 PRJNA706727_SRR13886719 ## colData names(11): srs project ... iso region ## reducedDimNames(0): ## mainExpName: NULL ## altExpNames(0): ## rowLinks: NULL ## rowTree: NULL ## colLinks: NULL ## colTree: NULL

title: Using the MicroBioMap package
text: 4000 microbes represented compendium. fairly rare may want subset compendium specific bug sample. , pick arbitrary examplar show just mechanics. Examine distribution abundance across samples compendium. Picking arbitrary threshold (, example), can limit samples plenty bacteria interest present.
code: shig_cpd_counts = counts(cpd)['Bacteria.Proteobacteria.Gammaproteobacteria.Enterobacterales.Enterobacteriaceae.Escherichia-Shigella',] hist(log10(shig_cpd_counts)) shig_cpd <- cpd[, log10(shig_cpd_counts)>2] dim(shig_cpd) ## [1]  4018 72769

what: Access the microbiome compendium from R
title: Access the microbiome compendium from R
text: dataset includes 170,000 samples publicly available 16S rRNA amplicon sequencing data, processed using pipeline reference database. goal MicroBioMap package simply expose data broad community Bioconductor R users smallest fuss possible. See vignette details.

title: Access the microbiome compendium from R
text: smoothest installation experience, use BiocManager Bioconductor package.

title: Access the microbiome compendium from R
text: Load compendium using: resulting object TreeSummarizedExperiment object. Currently, “tree” part TreeSummarizedExperiment populated, roadmap. loading compendium, immediate access nearly 170,000 microbiome samples.
